thread.title: InventHelp Inventor Designs THE TORCH (RDC-2032)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventor Designs THE TORCH (RDC-2032) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventor Designs THE TORCH (RDC-2032)
text:
One of America's leading inventor service companies, InventHelp is submitting THE TORCH to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 17, 2015
"I love sports and I noticed that many fans would have sore wrists after swinging towels and cheering during games,” said an inventor, from Fayetteville, N.C. “I thought it would be great if there was an alternative way to rally and support our teams, so I invented this.” He invented THE TORCH.
THE TORCH provides a fun way for sports fans to express support for the home team. It also offers an easier way to wave a rally towel without excessive stress and strain. As a result, it enhances the sporting event experience and it could create a sense of unity among spectators at a game. The invention features a novel, lightweight design that is convenient and easy to use so it is ideal for sports fans. Additionally, THE TORCH is producible in design variations.
The inventor described the invention design. “My design provides a fun and easy way to cheer on your favorite teams.”
The original design was submitted to the Raleigh office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-RDC-2032, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
